it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.model.match

Class PlayerTurn

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.model.match.PlayerTurn

  • public class PlayerTurn
extends Observable
    A representation of the turn of a player It contains information about:
    • The current action performed by the player
    • The number of actions available for the player to perform
    • The player the turn belongs to
    • The list of all the players damaged during the turn
    Author:
    Alessandro Fulgini, Lorenzo Farinelli, Tiziano Fucci

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerTurn(Player player)
      Creates a new turn for the specified player.

      Retrieves the list of actions the player can perform, according to the current state of the turn If the turn is over, the collection is empty If the user still has remaining actions, all the actions in the action card are returned If the user has finished his remaining actions, then the final action is returned

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerTurn

        public PlayerTurn(Player player)
        Creates a new turn for the specified player.
        Parameters:
        player - The object representing the player, not null

    • Method Detail

      • getAvailableActions

        public Collection<ActionEnum> getAvailableActions()
        Retrieves the list of actions the player can perform, according to the current state of the turn
        • If the turn is over, the collection is empty
        • If the user still has remaining actions, all the actions in the action card are returned
        • If the user has finished his remaining actions, then the final action is returned
        Returns:
        A read-only collection with the actions that the user can choose to perform

      • canPerformAction

        public boolean canPerformAction(ActionEnum action)
        Checks whether the provided action can be performed by the player
        Parameters:
        action - The action to test, not null
        Returns:
        true if the action can be performed, false otherwise

      • getTurnState

        public PlayerTurnState getTurnState()
        Retrieves the state the turn is into
        Returns:
        The object representing the state

      • setTurnState

        public void setTurnState(PlayerTurnState state)
        Sets the state the turn is into
        Parameters:
        state - The object representing the state, not null

      • addDamagedPlayer

        public void addDamagedPlayer(Player player)
        Adds given player to the set of players damaged during this turn
        Parameters:
        player - The player to be added

      • getDamagedPlayers

        public Set<Player> getDamagedPlayers()
        Retrieves the list of players that received a damage during this turn

        public int getRemainingActions()
        Retrieves the number of actions the user can still perform
        Returns:
        The count of remaining actions
